scenarioDescription:
The K2-284 Exoplanetary System


Overview

K2-284 is a star with 0.63 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.61 times its radius. It is located 349.87 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 0.12 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

K2-284 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the K2-284 system


K2-284 b

K2-284 b was discovered by the K2 observatory, in 2018-12, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of K2-284 b is 8.141 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-284 b is 2.780 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, K2-284 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system K2-284, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the K2.
name: K2-284 - System With 1 Exoplanet
